comments.body: The bisect never finished. It threw a stack trace, then setting an environment variable let it run, but it never got through the first test run. :(

Seems legible, though as someone that continues to develop bare metal, its a bit beyond my common usage. Though this next computer I'm getting will probably push me towards standardized development environments.

figgy.title: BrowseEverything fails to read from Folders which are shared with users (but for which the users themselves are not owners)

comments.body:
I am currently able to access resources in Team Drives from my account over the REST API for Drive using https://developers.google.com/drive/api/v3/reference/files/list?apix=true&apix_params=%7B%22corpora%22%3A%22allDrives%22%2C%22includeItemsFromAllDrives%22%3Atrue%2C%22includeTeamDriveItems%22%3Atrue%2C%22supportsAllDrives%22%3Atrue%2C%22supportsTeamDrives%22%3Atrue%2C%22fields%22%3A%22files(name%2Cparents%2CwebContentLink)%22%7D#try-it

All of these boolean parameters are being passed through the various Ruby Gems, so I suspect that the request is somehow being improperly formatted.

By rewriting how I interface with the Google Drive API, I can now retrieve Team Drive Folders. However, I am currently struggling to filter for Team Drive Folders which are members of other Folders (e. g. building a tree is difficult, as child Folders in a Team Drive do not indicate that they have parents).

I will check my work for errors and proceed with this.

comments.body: As @escowles points out above, the key is the the EAD container and the MODS shelfLocator.  With a few regular expressions in XQuery, I was able to match every container with a METS and, therefore, a path to an image.  Next step is to use that data in a bulk ingest.

princeton_ansible.title: Add test that zookeeper is running
Consider adding znode test back to solrcloud role
Add vim and ag as default packages
Provision solr 8 boxes for use by catalog-staging

comments.body:
Migrating solr data to a new znode.

1. On each solr box, create a copy of /etc/defaults/solr.in.sh to /etc/defaults/_new_solr.in.sh. Update the `ZK_HOST` param to append the new znode. When it's time to edit this config file, you can just swap in the copy.
1. Stop solr on all boxes.
1. On one box only:
   1. Start a tmux session.
   1. `cd /opt/solr`
   1. `bin/solr zk mkroot /solr7 -z lib-zk-staging1:2181,lib-zk-staging2:2181,lib-zk-staging3:2181`
   1. `bin/solr zk cp -r zk:/clusterstate.json zk:/solr7/clusterstate.json -z lib-zk-staging1:2181,lib-zk-staging2:2181,lib-zk-staging3:2181`
   1. `bin/solr zk cp -r zk:/aliases.json zk:/solr7/aliases.json -z lib-zk-staging1:2181,lib-zk-staging2:2181,lib-zk-staging3:2181`
   1. `bin/solr zk cp -r zk:/live_nodes zk:/solr7/live_nodes -z lib-zk-staging1:2181,lib-zk-staging2:2181,lib-zk-staging3:2181`
   1. `bin/solr zk cp -r zk:/overseer zk:/solr7/overseer -z lib-zk-staging1:2181,lib-zk-staging2:2181,lib-zk-staging3:2181`
   1. `bin/solr zk cp -r zk:/overseer_elect zk:/solr7/overseer_elect -z lib-zk-staging1:2181,lib-zk-staging2:2181,lib-zk-staging3:2181`
   1. `bin/solr zk cp -r zk:/collections zk:/solr7/collections -z lib-zk-staging1:2181,lib-zk-staging2:2181,lib-zk-staging3:2181`
   1. `bin/solr zk cp -r zk:/configs zk:/solr7/configs -z lib-zk-staging1:2181,lib-zk-staging2:2181,lib-zk-staging3:2181`
   1. Check the new znode contents: `bin/solr zk ls /solr7 -z lib-zk-staging1:2181,lib-zk-staging2:2181,lib-zk-staging3:2181`
   1. Delete those data from their old locations.
   1. `bin/solr zk rm -r /clusterstate.json -z lib-zk-staging1:2181,lib-zk-staging2:2181,lib-zk-staging3:2181`
   1. `bin/solr zk rm -r /aliases.json -z lib-zk-staging1:2181,lib-zk-staging2:2181,lib-zk-staging3:2181`
   1. `bin/solr zk rm -r /live_nodes -z lib-zk-staging1:2181,lib-zk-staging2:2181,lib-zk-staging3:2181`
   1. `bin/solr zk rm -r /overseer -z lib-zk-staging1:2181,lib-zk-staging2:2181,lib-zk-staging3:2181`
   1. `bin/solr zk rm -r /overseer_elect -z lib-zk-staging1:2181,lib-zk-staging2:2181,lib-zk-staging3:2181`
   1. `bin/solr zk rm -r /collections -z lib-zk-staging1:2181,lib-zk-staging2:2181,lib-zk-staging3:2181`
   1. `bin/solr zk rm -r /configs -z lib-zk-staging1:2181,lib-zk-staging2:2181,lib-zk-staging3:2181`
   1. Check the root node contents: `bin/solr zk ls / -z lib-zk-staging1:2181,lib-zk-staging2:2181,lib-zk-staging3:2181`
1. On each solr server, modify the solr.in.sh configs by swapping in the files you created in step 1. Ensure the owner remains `root:deploy`.
1. Start solr again.
